intro: Heliophila mafubensis, commonly known as the Mafubu heliophyte, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun exposure. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a mild, aromatic scent, while its flowers are small and white or pale yellow. Heliophila mafubensis is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, contributing to local biodiversity.
